meanings.definition: A person who desecrates sacred things or places.
meanings.sent1: The desecrater entered the church and vandalized the altar.
meanings.sent2: The desecrater was caught defacing the ancient tomb.
meanings.sent3: The desecrater thought it would be funny to draw on the sacred tree.
meanings.sent4: Her actions as a desecrater left a trail of destruction in the temple.
meanings.sent5: The desecrater's disregard for sacred spaces shocked the community.

meanings.definition: To treat with disrespect or irreverence.
meanings.sent1: Please do not desecrate the memorial by leaving trash around it.
meanings.sent2: The vandals desecrated the historic building by spray painting graffiti on its walls.
meanings.sent3: He desecrated the rules of the game by cheating during the match.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to desecrate the family heirloom caused a rift in the family.
meanings.sent5: The students were warned not to desecrate the library books by writing in them.
